result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jamari Omar Smith

records.addlTxt:
Clerk contacted the parties via email regarding Scheduling Conference. 
NEW TIME: Scheduling Conference scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Hearing will be held via Zoom video Conference.
Defendant will appear via Zoom Video Conference.

Defendant Jamari Omar Smith appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Michael B Plaisted appeared by video for Jamari Omar Smith.  Prosecuting Attorney Kaylan Reilly in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in Court for Preliminary hearing. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Feiss, Branch 46. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial. State filed original Information. Defense counsel waived reading of Information, and entered a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of Defendant.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Attorney Megan Kaldunski was erroneously added to the case.

Defendant Jamari Omar Smith not in court, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Attorney Plaisted is in trial in another court.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Jamari Omar Smith appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Michael J Cerniglia appeared by video for Jamari Omar Smith.  Attorney Peter John Cannon appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Feiss, Branch 46. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Jamari Omar Smith
Current: 3227 N 16th St, Milwaukee, WI 53206 United States  (Effective: 09-29-2022)
Prior: 2410 North 39th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53210
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.

Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
